name: Black Bean Tostadas With Corn Relish
description: I'm not sure why I've never cooked tostadas before: They're effortless, are open to invention, taste warm and crunchy, and can be made in about 15 minutes. Essentially an overloaded taco--tortilla topped with meat or beans, perhaps a bit of...

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the frozen corn with water until thawed, then drain well and toss with scallions and 1 tablespoon oil. In a separate bowl, toss the halved tomatoes with the minced jalapeño. Season both to taste. If possible, complete these steps in the morning then refrigerate, so the flavors have time to mingle.

Preheat the oven to 475 F. Lay the tortillas out on a baking sheet and brush both sides with remaining oil. Drain and rinse beans, and sprinkle over tortillas. (I might experiment with some dried cumin or chili powder on the beans). Top with tomato salsa and cheese, and bake for ten minutes, or until crispy and golden on the edges.
While the tostadas cook, cut the avocado into chunks. Top cooked tostadas with the corn relish and avocado, and a sprinkle of salt. Serve immediately.
